items.htmlTitle: Ed Koch, mayor who became a symbol of NYC, dies at 88

imageobject.caption: Former New York mayor Ed Koch died Friday. (Photo: Frank Franklin II, AP)
Rep. Ed Koch, D-N.Y., second from left, celebrates with Bess Myerson, left, Carol Bellamy and Diana Goldin after being elected as New York's mayor on Nov. 8, 1977, in New York. (Photo: Ray...
New York Mayor Ed Koch greets a commuter who walked across the Brooklyn Bridge during a transit strike on April 7, 1980, in New York. (Photo: Carlos Rene Perez, AP)
New York Mayor Ed Koch stands with Beatles fans paying tribute to the late John Lennon during a silent vigil on Dec. 14, 1980, in Central Park. (Photo: Rene Perez, AP)
New York Mayor Ed Koch raises his hands while addressing the opening session of the Democratic National Convention on July 16, 1984, in San Francisco. (Photo: Ira Schwarz, AP)
New York Mayor Ed Koch carries Broadway dancer Ann Reinking during a performance at the annual Inner Circle gathering of the New York Press Club on March 8, 1987, in New York. (Photo: Richard...
New York Mayor Ed Koch kisses singer-actress Diana Ross on the steps of City Hall on July 6, 1983, in New York. (Photo: Marty Lederhandler, AP)
Republican presidential nominee Ronald Reagan, left, walks with New York Mayor Ed Koch during a meeting on Oct. 17, 1980, at Gracie Mansion in New York. (Photo: AP)

A makeup artist powders the head of New York Mayor Ed Koch before the start of his new television call-in program, "Koch on Call" at a television station on March 15, 1987. (Photo: David Bookstave,...
Architect Phillip Johnson, left, Jacqueline Kennedy Onassis, Bess Myerson and Rep. Ed Koch, D-N.Y., leave after a news conference for the Committee to Save Grand Central Station at Grand Central...
New York Mayor Ed Koch, left, and former Rep. Bella Abzug, D-N.Y., chat with President Carter during a meeting in the Oval Office on Feb. 2, 1978. (Photo: John Duricka, AP)
New York Mayor Ed Koch delivers his concession speech after losing the Democratic gubernatorial primary election to New York Lt. Gov. Mario Cuomo on Sept. 24, 1982, in New York. (Photo: Ray...
Former New York mayor Ed Koch leaves a morning breakfast where New York Mayor Michael Bloomberg discussed the growth of Lower Manhattan on Sept. 6, 2001. (Photo: Spencer Platt, Getty Images)
Former New York mayor Ed Koch speaks at the Republican National Convention on Aug. 30, 2004, in New York. Koch, a Democrat, supported the re-election of President George W. Bush. (Photo: Joe...
Former New York City mayor Ed Koch attends the celebration of his 85th birthday at the St. Regis Hotel on Nov. 18, 2009, in New York City. (Photo: Jemal Countess for Bryan Cave LLP via Getty Images)
imageobject.copyrightholder: Jemal Countess for Bryan Cave LLP via Getty Images
